RoleContents: ['Rest in peace. We will remember the life you once lived.']
LocationDesc: The catastrophe destroyed everything—but not the human will.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Serial Murder
Desc: Wanshi hands you his autopsy report. Despite his neat, composed handwriting, it reveals a jaw-dropping truth: each victim had their throat slit with surgical precision, their blood drained, and their bodies discarded carelessly near the ritual site.
LocationDesc: He seeks justice for those innocent victims.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Serial Murder
Desc: In other words, the killer went to great lengths to abduct them—only to discard their bodies like refuse once the ritual was complete, with not the slightest intention of offering them a burial.\n\nYou're both beyond shocked. What kind of heartless monster could commit such cruelty? Still, you both make a vow that someday, you will sever the chain of evil.
RoleContents: ['We must find the killer and bring judgment upon them.']
LocationDesc: He seeks justice for those innocent victims.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Innocent Lambs
Desc: Sitting beneath a lush tree, you both examine once again the crude wooden carving recovered from the altar—a goat crouched low to the ground, limbs tucked beneath its body, head bowed submissively to the base of the altar, as if offering its neck for slaughter.
LocationDesc: Death isn't the end of the story... at least not in the killer's eyes.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Innocent Lambs
Desc: The tribal cultists must have placed the carving on the altar with deliberate intent. You can't help but wonder—do they see the victims as mere "sacrificial lambs" rather than fellow humans with souls?\n\n"To the tribespeople, these victims are nothing more than livestock..." His voice carries a rare, uncontainable fury. The cruelty of the realization has utterly enraged him.
RoleContents: ['I hope we can stop the next tragedy before it happens.']
LocationDesc: Death isn't the end of the story... at least not in the killer's eyes.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Invisible Star
Desc: The closer you get to the outskirts of New Zohik—an unremarkable and long-forgotten city—the heavier the dread in your heart grows.
LocationDesc: Invisible threads connect the different locations together.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Invisible Star
Desc: According to Wanshi's deduction, the killer has been committing crimes in various locations for a reason—their true intent is to arrange the ritual sites into a specific pattern, one that may serve some unknown purpose.\n\nYou don't know what lies ahead, nor do you understand the killer's true purpose, but you've steeled yourselves to face whatever crisis may come.
RoleContents: ['I will remain by your side... until we uncover the truth behind the catastrophe.']
LocationDesc: Invisible threads connect the different locations together.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: The Children's Gift
Desc: After a long day of travel, you find a wide clearing in the forest to make camp. You take on the task of setting up the sleeping tents, while Wanshi prepares the evening meal.
LocationDesc: Caring for the children, no matter the time or place, seems to have become an instinct of his.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: The Children's Gift
Desc: "Ah, I packed the wrong bag." A quiet mutter comes from behind you. Turning around, you see Wanshi pulling a handful of glinting candy from the pouch where food supplies are supposed to be.\n\n"I was planning to bring these as gifts when we return... Looks like I packed the wrong one by mistake. Sorry, it seems we'll have to make do with emergency rations tonight." He apologizes sheepishly. Of course, you forgive him for this innocent "mistake."
RoleContents: ['Next time, maybe pack the gifts and food in different colored bags...']
LocationDesc: Caring for the children, no matter the time or place, seems to have become an instinct of his.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Pharmaceutical Knowledge
Desc: The deeper you go into the forest, the more you notice how unusually lush the medicinal herbs are in this area, as if someone had once selectively cultivated them.
LocationDesc: Wherever poisonous herbs grow, a cure is never far away.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Pharmaceutical Knowledge
Desc: In the Scorched Borderland, ordinary people rarely use herbal medicine, and all of Wanshi's knowledge of herbs comes from his late adoptive mother. Who has been tending to this forest?\n\nWanshi can't help but recall the scent of herbs he noticed in the castle. There seems to be only one possible answer: the tribespeople still uphold the tradition of herbal medicine.
RoleContents: ['Watch out—there must be tribespeople nearby.']
LocationDesc: Wherever poisonous herbs grow, a cure is never far away.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Mysterious Identity
Desc: After the fierce skirmish ends, Wanshi crouches to inspect the motionless corpses of the Living Dead, discovering that they all bear pentagram emblems identical to the one on the wooden goat carving. Moreover, the markings' strokes and colors are completely identical, clearly crafted by the same hand.
LocationDesc: They all had names in life, but in death, only an identity remains.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Mysterious Identity
Desc: Morigan excitedly calls out as he uncovers a crucial clue: "This must be the work of the tribe's priestess! The tribe has the custom of seeking her blessing before battle or ritual sacrifice."\n\nThe identity of the Living Dead is now clear—they were a group of tribespeople who were sacrificed for the ritual.
RoleContents: ['There might be more Living Dead waiting for us. Stay alert.']
LocationDesc: They all had names in life, but in death, only an identity remains.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Voluntary Sacrifice
Desc: Beneath the great tree, you find several bone knives—some aged, some nearly new, but all crafted in the same style. A few lie near the feet of the desiccated corpses; others are still lodged in their chests. It's clear these weapons once belonged to the dead.
LocationDesc: Such cruelty... Does the sacrifice really mean anything?
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Voluntary Sacrifice
Desc: "These tribal folk aren't very bright. They seem to believe that only by killing themselves with weapons crafted themselves can they earn divine favor... Bah! If you ask me, any god that tells you to kill yourself is full of crap. What can be more important than your own life?!" Morigan clearly despises this cruel belief, putting particular emphasis on the word "crap."
RoleContents: ["No matter human or demon, the dead can't put on a damn show—only the living can. If you ask me, those spreading this twisted religion are the ones who should go to hell!"]
LocationDesc: Such cruelty... Does the sacrifice really mean anything?
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Mysterious Scents
Desc: After defeating more Living Dead, the two of you press on toward the direction of the high-hanging sun. The heavy scents of herbs, mingled with a gloomy mist, linger in the thick forest, refusing to fade. You can't help but wonder if you're still caught in the cage of the one pulling the strings, and your struggle all but in vain.
LocationDesc: The scents of herb linger in the forest, refusing to fade, reminding you that this isn't over yet.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Mysterious Scents
Desc: "...We're back where we started." A few hours later, the two of you find yourselves back under the tree where Wanshi has left a mark. The desiccated corpses hanging high among the branches watch in silence, as if silently proclaiming that the killer still lurks within this forest.\n\nYou pull out your knife and carve another mark into the bark, then set off with Wanshi in a different direction.
RoleContents: ["Stay close to me. Don't get separated."]
LocationDesc: The scents of herb linger in the forest, refusing to fade, reminding you that this isn't over yet.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Millennial Strife
Desc: The arduous trek through the forest still shows no sign of ending. During the long, monotonous journey, you bring up the topic of tribal history once more with Morigan.
LocationDesc: No one has ever truly known the whole truth of history. You and I have only caught glimpses of its reflections.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Millennial Strife
Desc: "You wanna know about that tribe's past? Honestly, I don't know much either. Ever since hundreds of years ago, the tribesfolk and borderlanders go to war the second they see each other. Every time, it's a brutal fight to the death—no one even remembers who started it all."\n\nMorigan perches on your shoulder, shaking his head as he speaks, clearly losing patience after this long, grueling mountain trek.
LocationDesc: No one has ever truly known the whole truth of history. You and I have only caught glimpses of its reflections.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Millennial Strife
Desc: "Ah, one thing I'm sure about, though—those angels don't discriminate when they hunt you humans. Rather than hating each other, you'd better join forces and take down the Sanctuary first, and deal with your old grudges later."
RoleContents: ['Will there ever come a day when the tribespeople and borderlanders can find reconciliation...']
LocationDesc: No one has ever truly known the whole truth of history. You and I have only caught glimpses of its reflections.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Holy Death
Desc: You ask Wanshi about the meaning of the pentagram engraved on the base of wooden carving. Wanshi replies that he has only come across vague references to it in the Great Library. According to legend, it is an oracle that can be used to summon the "Holy Death."
LocationDesc: You press on.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Holy Death
Desc: "According to the tribe's oracle, the Holy Death is a towering, pale giant who can resurrect all tribespeople unjustly slain in war, and turn their blood into blades to strike down those who took their lives." Wanshi recounts the tale with utter calm, his voice betraying no personal feelings about the legend.\n\nWhen you cautiously ask for his thoughts on the legend, he simply shakes his head, saying that no revenge is worth sacrificing more lives.
RoleContents: ['If carrying out revenge demands the shedding of even more blood, then it is nothing more than a tragic cycle doomed to repeat itself.']
LocationDesc: You press on.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Relentless Assault
Desc: Canary sends wave after wave of Living Dead toward Wanshi.\n\nWanshi raises his lantern, drawing in their souls one after another. Rotting corpses fall beneath the trees, finally finding eternal rest in the forest.
RoleContents: ['Rest in peace...']
LocationDesc: Canary sends wave after wave of Living Dead toward Wanshi.
LocationDescUnselect: Canary sends wave after wave of Living Dead toward Wanshi.

Name: Feint and Observe
Desc: Canary sends wave after wave of Living Dead toward Wanshi.\n\nRather than engaging them head-on, Wanshi makes feinting movements to draw their attention while observing the direction of their approach.
RoleContents: ['Canary escaped... this way.']
LocationDesc: Canary sends wave after wave of Living Dead toward Wanshi.
LocationDescUnselect: Canary sends wave after wave of Living Dead toward Wanshi.

Name: Frontal Breakthrough
Desc: The number of Living Dead suddenly surges—it seems you're getting close to the ritual formation.\n\nWithout hesitation, Wanshi raises his handgun, ready to break through the blockade of rotting flesh head-on.
RoleContents: ["I'll be there soon... Gray Raven!"]
LocationDesc: The number of Living Dead suddenly surges—it seems you're getting close to the ritual formation.
LocationDescUnselect: The number of Living Dead suddenly surges—it seems you're getting close to the ritual formation.

Name: Flank Breakthrough
Desc: The number of Living Dead suddenly surges—it seems you're getting close to the ritual formation.\n\nWanshi slips into a blind spot of the Living Dead, ready to use the cover of the trees' shadows to break through the blockade of rotting flesh.
RoleContents: ["A breach... I'll break through from there!"]
LocationDesc: The number of Living Dead suddenly surges—it seems you're getting close to the ritual formation.
LocationDescUnselect: The number of Living Dead suddenly surges—it seems you're getting close to the ritual formation.

Name: Attack Canary Now
Desc: There Canary is, surrounded by the Living Dead, but Gray Raven is nowhere to be seen nearby.\n\nWanshi fires several copper bullets at the white-haired priestess, but they are intercepted by the Living Dead at her command. With each shot, rotting corpses explode into putrid blood and flesh, splattering the ground and filling the air with a nauseating stench.
RoleContents: ['...You and your cheap tricks!']
LocationDesc: There Canary is, surrounded by the Living Dead.
LocationDescUnselect: There Canary is, surrounded by the Living Dead.

Name: Deal With the Living Dead First
Desc: There Canary is, surrounded by the Living Dead, but Gray Raven is nowhere to be seen nearby.\n\nThe Living Dead lunge at Wanshi one after another, forcing him to deal with these troublesome obstacles first. Copper bullets rip through their skulls, painting the forest floor a brownish red.
RoleContents: ['So many people... Did they all willingly offer their lives for "Carcosa"?']
LocationName: Deal With the Living Dead First
LocationDesc: There Canary is, surrounded by the Living Dead.
LocationDescUnselect: There Canary is, surrounded by the Living Dead.

Name: Gaze Upon the Mortal Realm
Desc: You pick up a fragment—a memory from the time when the Cardinal Deity still reigned over the mortal realm.\nIn that era, humanity worshipped the Cardinal Deity as their absolute authority, building countless magnificent temples in his name and composing endless hymns and verses in his praise. And the Deity answered all their wishes—though never without a price.
LocationDesc: The two of you fall into a boundless sea of history, where countless fragments of memory float.
LocationDescUnselect: The two of you fall into a boundless sea of history, where countless fragments of memory float.

Name: Gaze Upon the Mortal Realm
Desc: And so, you see a father who, after wishing for a good harvest, lost his young daughter—trampled to death by a runaway horse the very day after the bountiful harvest.\n\nBut the father dared not voice his anger at the priest. He only swallowed his grief in silence, cursing himself for ever believing that miracles could come without a price.
RoleContents: ['...Such is the "Blood Tax" the Sanctuary collects from the mortals.']
LocationDesc: The two of you fall into a boundless sea of history, where countless fragments of memory float.
LocationDescUnselect: The two of you fall into a boundless sea of history, where countless fragments of memory float.

Name: Look Down Upon the Heavens
Desc: You pick up a fragment—a memory of the Cardinal Deity seated upon his holy throne in the heavenly court.\n\nAs the chosen executor of the Supreme Heaven's will, every word he uttered bore absolute authority. The four great angels served him with unwavering loyalty. With a single decree, he could reduce an entire city to scorched earth—its people turned into "tax meat."
LocationDesc: The two of you fall into a boundless sea of history, where countless fragments of memory float.
LocationDescUnselect: The two of you fall into a boundless sea of history, where countless fragments of memory float.

Name: Look Down Upon the Heavens
Desc: But seated at the pinnacle of the heavenly court, he held nothing in his heart—no compassion for humanity, no wrath for demons.\n\nTo keep the "laws" of the three realms in motion, he had remained silent for millennia, wordlessly fulfilling his duties as the supreme deity.
RoleContents: ['...What exactly are the "laws" established by the Supreme Heaven?']
LocationDesc: The two of you fall into a boundless sea of history, where countless fragments of memory float.
LocationDescUnselect: The two of you fall into a boundless sea of history, where countless fragments of memory float.

Name: Look at the Borderlanders
Desc: You look toward a borderlander army marching across the wilderness. A thousand years ago, following the Cardinal Deity's instructions, the borderlanders migrated from a faraway land to escape locust plagues and pestilence. But the original inhabitants—the tribespeople—refused to share their sacred land. Whether by intent or accident, they set fire to borderlander fields and stole their crops, trying to drive the outsiders away.
LocationDesc: A thousand years ago, the Cardinal Deity ordered the massacre of the tribespeople, and thus began a war that rages to this day.
LocationDescUnselect: A thousand years ago, the Cardinal Deity ordered the massacre of the tribespeople, and thus began a war that rages to this day.

Name: Look at the Borderlanders
Desc: Thus, under the Cardinal Deity's command, a disciplined and well-trained expeditionary force was forged. To seize enough food to quell their hunger, the borderlanders waged war against tribespeople.\n\nWar turned into massacre. The bloodshed dragged on for nearly a decade. Not even children were spared. But the results were immediate—just ten years later, the borderlanders established a "prosperous" civilization on this land.
RoleContents: ["With the tribespeople's blood as their foundation, the borderlanders secured their place of survival on this land."]
LocationDesc: A thousand years ago, the Cardinal Deity ordered the massacre of the tribespeople, and thus began a war that rages to this day.
LocationDescUnselect: A thousand years ago, the Cardinal Deity ordered the massacre of the tribespeople, and thus began a war that rages to this day.

Name: Look at the Tribespeople
Desc: You look toward a group of tribespeople who have taken refuge deep within the forest, fleeing the devastation of war. When the Cardinal Deity's army brought slaughter upon their kin, a few among them escaped into the woods, carrying with them the divine oracle of the Haruka tribe—cradling it like a spark of vengeance.
LocationDesc: A thousand years ago, the Cardinal Deity ordered the massacre of the tribespeople, and thus began a war that rages to this day.
LocationDescUnselect: A thousand years ago, the Cardinal Deity ordered the massacre of the tribespeople, and thus began a war that rages to this day.

Name: Look at the Tribespeople
Desc: For centuries, they poured their efforts into deciphering the cryptic script of the divine oracle, desperately seeking a way to summon the Holy Death. Yet most of their sacrifices ended in vain—the conditions for summoning were far more exacting than they had ever imagined. As their numbers dwindled, some chose to abandon hatred and survive in the untouched depths of the forest, far from the reach of the borderlanders.
LocationDesc: A thousand years ago, the Cardinal Deity ordered the massacre of the tribespeople, and thus began a war that rages to this day.
LocationDescUnselect: A thousand years ago, the Cardinal Deity ordered the massacre of the tribespeople, and thus began a war that rages to this day.

Name: Look at the Tribespeople
Desc: And all of this was seen by the Cardinal Deity. For reasons known to none, he never moved against the tribe living in hiding, but instead allowed them to grow and multiply in the forest.
RoleContents: ['Perhaps the Cardinal Deity had known from the beginning that this revenge would one day reignite.']
LocationDesc: A thousand years ago, the Cardinal Deity ordered the massacre of the tribespeople, and thus began a war that rages to this day.
LocationDescUnselect: A thousand years ago, the Cardinal Deity ordered the massacre of the tribespeople, and thus began a war that rages to this day.

Name: Look Back Into the Past
Desc: You attempt to envision what would have happened had the Cardinal Deity not fallen. The outcome remains unchanged—the three realms would have undergone no changes, and the laws would continue to operate with the unyielding certainty of the Supreme Heaven's will.
LocationDesc: The blood-red "amber" continues pulsing, ceaselessly unveiling the past and future of its projections.
LocationDescUnselect: The blood-red "amber" continues pulsing, ceaselessly unveiling the past and future of its projections.

Name: Look Back Into the Past
Desc: This may not be the ideal solution, but for some, it is stable enough—so long as they are willing to accept a fate that might one day see them fall beneath the blades of angels, the human race will continue to thrive for millennia under the Sanctuary's protection.
RoleContents: ['To the angels, humanity is little more than livestock in a pasture... By surrendering their individual free will, they secure the prosperity of their entire race.']
LocationDesc: The blood-red "amber" continues pulsing, ceaselessly unveiling the past and future of its projections.
LocationDescUnselect: The blood-red "amber" continues pulsing, ceaselessly unveiling the past and future of its projections.

Name: Imagine a Future
Desc: You attempt to envision what future lies ahead for the Scorched Borderland in the absence of the Cardinal Deity. The chaotic projections pause for a few seconds—before settling into utter blankness.
LocationDesc: The blood-red "amber" continues pulsing, ceaselessly unveiling the past and future of its projections.
LocationDescUnselect: The blood-red "amber" continues pulsing, ceaselessly unveiling the past and future of its projections.

Name: Imagine a Future
Desc: The memory cocoon cannot store visions it hasn't witnessed, therefore it holds no answer for your question about a distant time.\n\nBut at least you arrive at one truth: not even the gods can fully foresee the fate of humanity.
RoleContents: ['The answer to this question can only be found by us humans.']
LocationDesc: The blood-red "amber" continues pulsing, ceaselessly unveiling the past and future of its projections.
LocationDescUnselect: The blood-red "amber" continues pulsing, ceaselessly unveiling the past and future of its projections.

Name: Break the Amber
Desc: Wanshi believes that humanity needs no gods to rule over them, while Uriel is determined to take the Cardinal Deity's place.\n\nTo stop Uriel from merging with the Cardinal Deity's memories, you and Wanshi raise your weapons together. As your bullets find their target, the soft amber is shattered into pieces, and his final gift is banished.
LocationDesc: Humanity needs no gods to rule over them.
LocationDescUnselect: Humanity needs no gods to rule over them.

Name: Crying Infant
Desc:
As you walk through the shadowed forest, a sharp cry suddenly breaks the silence.

You both turn toward the sound, only to find a crying infant nestled in the grass within a wicker basket.
There are no human settlements in this area, so the child's presence is undeniably suspicious... yet leaving him behind is simply not an option.
RoleContents: ["This is probably the bandits' trap. Be careful."]
LocationDesc: As you walk through the shadowed forest, a sharp cry suddenly breaks the silence.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Crying Infant
Desc: Just as Wanshi has predicted, the moment you step forward and reach for the basket, a group of fierce, bald-headed men spring out from the grass.\n\nAnd you are ready for them. After teaching them a lesson together, you not only manage to reunite the baby with his parents, but also force the bandits to cough up a hefty sum of coins as compensation.
LocationDesc: As you walk through the shadowed forest, a sharp cry suddenly breaks the silence.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Crying Infant
Desc: Together, you launch an attack on the grass, catching the bandits hiding within completely off guard. Terrified, they scatter and flee in panic.\n\nAfter driving them away, you reunite the baby with his parents, who gratefully offer you some supplies.
LocationDesc: As you walk through the shadowed forest, a sharp cry suddenly breaks the silence.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Lonely Gravekeeper
Desc: Leaning back into his rocking chair, the white-haired gravekeeper starts to recount stories of the past.\n\nEver since the disaster thirty years ago, no souls have been laid to rest in this cemetery, nor have mourners come to visit. Now too frail to wield a weapon, he asks for your help—to find a way to keep this sacred resting place for the departed undisturbed by the Living Dead.
RoleContents: ["I'm going to be... the last keeper of this cemetery."]
LocationDesc: Vultures roost upon withered boughs, over the once-fertile land where their forebears once thrived.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Lonely Gravekeeper
Desc: Wanshi raises his lantern, guiding the restless Living Dead near the cemetery to peace. Through their memories, you learn that they were the gravekeeper's own family, unable to find rest since the disaster ten years ago.
LocationDesc: Vultures roost upon withered boughs, over the once-fertile land where their forebears once thrived.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Lonely Gravekeeper
Desc: You and Wanshi hurry back to the cemetery, only to find the gravekeeper already gone. On the table lies a handwritten letter, expressing his gratitude for helping him lift his greatest burden. He has chosen to spend his remaining days seeking out sights he never had the chance to see. In return, he has left all his belongings to you.
LocationDesc: Vultures roost upon withered boughs, over the once-fertile land where their forebears once thrived.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Lonely Gravekeeper
Desc: You and Wanshi spend some time restoring the cemetery's decayed fence, returning it to its former state.\n\nWhile repairing, you discover several ancient tomes from the pre-catastrophe era in the storage room. Inside are records of "black magic" spells used by the tribespeople—likely remnants left behind by those who came before.
LocationDesc: Vultures roost upon withered boughs, over the once-fertile land where their forebears once thrived.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Lonely Gravekeeper
Desc: In gratitude, the gravekeeper gifts you the ancient tomes. From them, you gain considerable knowledge of "black magic"—a rewarding find.
LocationDesc: Vultures roost upon withered boughs, over the once-fertile land where their forebears once thrived.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Quack Doctor
Desc: "Elixirs for sale! Elixirs for sale! Whatever strange illness you've got, one bottle is all it takes—cured instantly!"\n\nThe suspicious call halts your steps. A man, also wearing a bird-beak mask, stands on the street corner of the town, shadily hawking his "homemade elixirs."
LocationDesc: "Elixirs for sale! Elixirs for sale! Whatever strange illness you've got, one bottle is all it takes—cured instantly!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Quack Doctor
Desc: A mother, her face etched with exhaustion, stands nearby, repeatedly asking the doctor the same question: if she mortgages her house for the elixir, will her dying child truly be brought back from the brink of death?
RoleContents: ["Of course! This is the miracle elixir—there's no illness it can't cure!"]
LocationDesc: "Elixirs for sale! Elixirs for sale! Whatever strange illness you've got, one bottle is all it takes—cured instantly!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Quack Doctor
Desc: Under Wanshi's thorough questioning, the quack quickly crumbles. Realizing he has been exposed, he takes the first opportunity to flee.\n\nWanshi examines the child and discovers it's just a common fever. The quack has been deliberately fearmongering, delaying proper treatment. With a few herbal remedies, the child quickly makes a full recovery.
LocationDesc: "Elixirs for sale! Elixirs for sale! Whatever strange illness you've got, one bottle is all it takes—cured instantly!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Quack Doctor
Desc: Wanshi quietly leads the mother away while you pose as another "patient" seeking the quack's help. As expected, he gives exactly the same diagnosis—that you are gravely ill and dying, and only his miracle elixir can cure such a dire affliction.
LocationDesc: "Elixirs for sale! Elixirs for sale! Whatever strange illness you've got, one bottle is all it takes—cured instantly!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Quack Doctor
Desc: Once the mother realizes the truth, she angrily rallies the townsfolk, who help her turn the quack over to the local constable. The quack receives his due punishment, and thanks to Wanshi's proper diagnosis, her child soon makes a full recovery.
LocationDesc: "Elixirs for sale! Elixirs for sale! Whatever strange illness you've got, one bottle is all it takes—cured instantly!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: A Daughter's Request
Desc: A young girl tearfully tells you that her father went hunting in the forest three days ago and never returned. Fearing the worst, she begs you to search for him.\n\nFollowing her directions, you and Wanshi arrive at a camp in the woods, only to find that her father has already turned into a Living Dead. Wanshi has no choice but to put him out of his misery.
LocationDesc: A young girl blocks your path.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: A Daughter's Request
Desc: After you return to town, the girl rushes up to you and anxiously asks if you've found any sign of her father.
RoleContents: ['H-have you seen my dad?']
LocationDesc: A young girl blocks your path.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: A Daughter's Request
Desc: You tell her the truth. The girl breaks down in tears, unable to accept such a cruel reality. But then Wanshi recounts her father's final memory—in his last moments, he still had enough strength to make it back to town. Yet, fearing he might turn into a Living Dead and harm his daughter, he chained his wrists tightly to the wooden stakes at the camp.
LocationDesc: A young girl blocks your path.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: A Daughter's Request
Desc: After regaining her composure, she thanks you for telling her the truth. Without your help, she might have ventured into the forest herself—only to meet the very fate her father had feared. She promises you that she will live on with strength.
LocationDesc: A young girl blocks your path.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: A Daughter's Request
Desc: You can't bring yourself to tell her the truth, so you simply say that you found no trace of anyone. The girl looks disappointed but still wants to give you some coins as thanks.\n\nYou decline the money and remind her to stay safe before leaving the town.
LocationDesc: A young girl blocks your path.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Strife
Desc: "Let's make him a blood slave! We can hand him over next time the angels come!"\n\nInside a crude farmhouse, two borderlanders are fiercely beating a tribesman. In the Scorched Borderland, they treat captured tribespeople as slaves, and some even hand them over to the angels to avoid paying the "blood tax."
LocationDesc: "Let's make him a blood slave! We can hand him over next time the angels come!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Strife
Desc: Almost no one speaks up for the tribespeople, as it has become an unwritten rule forged through a millennium of relentless mutual slaughter.
RoleContents: ["What do you want? I'm warning you, don't try to steal him. We're the ones who caught this tribesman."]
LocationDesc: "Let's make him a blood slave! We can hand him over next time the angels come!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Strife
Desc: "Huh? Are you two out of your minds? You actually want to save a tribesman?" The borderlander clearly thinks you are idiots, but when he sees the glittering coins, he reluctantly releases the captive, spits, and walks away.
LocationDesc: "Let's make him a blood slave! We can hand him over next time the angels come!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Strife
Desc: "...What do you want this time? I won't thank you monsters." The tribesman curls up on the ground, still glaring at you with anger. Wanshi silently signals him to run. After a tense moment, the tribesman stands up and hurries into the dense forest.\n\nYou know this act won't change a world drenched in madness, but at least you have saved a living soul—and that's enough for now.
LocationDesc: "Let's make him a blood slave! We can hand him over next time the angels come!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Strife
Desc: You both raise your guns, demanding the borderlanders release the tribesman. The two men go pale with fear, hurling curses as they beat a hasty retreat.
LocationDesc: "Let's make him a blood slave! We can hand him over next time the angels come!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Strife
Desc: "Haha! What a day—first the little lunatics, now the big ones. So, you borderlanders have started killing each other!" The tribesman you have rescued shows no gratitude. Instead, he laughs mockingly in your face.\n\nYou offer no explanation, simply leaving the farm in silence. You know that one act of mercy won't erase a thousand years of bloodshed, but at least you have saved a living soul—and that's enough for now.
LocationDesc: "Let's make him a blood slave! We can hand him over next time the angels come!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lies secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Blood-Stained Card Table
Desc: At noon, you gather around a long dining table. She sits with perfect poise, elegantly slicing and eating the meat on her plate. Yet the sight calls back the memory of not long ago, when she lay collapsed beneath the card table—moments away from being torn apart by angels as the loser.
LocationDesc: This narrow table carries the weight of countless desires and lives.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Blood-Stained Card Table
Desc: But just before the tragedy became irreversible, you made your move and chose.
RoleContents: ['So, you remember now? Then I owe you a proper thank-you. Thank you for coming to my rescue that day, my dear Blood Con-tra-ctor.']
LocationDesc: This narrow table carries the weight of countless desires and lives.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: The Girl's Past
Desc: On the road to Whitehorse, Lilith tells you again and again the story of her past: a girl whose entire family was slaughtered by the Sanctuary. Determined to seek justice for her parents, she sat down at the Sanctuary's card table, ready to face Archangel Raphael in what she thought would be a fair match... only to be undone by deceit, her blood splattering across the floor.
LocationDesc: You saved her, though back then you knew nothing about her.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: The Girl's Past
Desc: You know an ordinary girl could never summon the courage to face an archangel head-on, nor would she gamble with her life for vengeance. Her tale is riddled with holes. Yet with your memories still clouded, you lack the clarity to challenge her story.
RoleContents: ["That's how it happened... Shall I recount it all from the start for you again?"]
LocationDesc: You saved her, though back then you knew nothing about her.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Root of Conflict
Desc: On the long road, your memories resurface: you had gone to the Sanctuary's card table alone, seeking clues about Madam Raphael. But when you arrived, all you found was a blood-soaked girl lying collapsed on the ground.
LocationDesc: Over time, you built a measure of trust—an unspoken pact never to pry into what the other chose not to reveal.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Root of Conflict
Desc: Through the power of the Blood Covenant, you glimpsed her soul. In her dying dream, you saw that she had once stood face to face with Raphael, only to be executed for daring to seek the truth of Mammon's treasure.\n\nThat girl, Lilith, has since been reborn as the "Famine Knight," and now walks beside you as your companion.
RoleContents: ["So you've finally remembered the moment of our meeting... but don't hold your horses. There are still many more stories waiting for you to recall."]
LocationDesc: Over time, you built a measure of trust—an unspoken pact never to pry into what the other chose not to reveal.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: A Concluded Game
Desc: You come across the remnants of a card game cut short. A rough wooden table lies in disarray, strewn with crude homemade cards and abandoned chips. Lilith crouches down with interest, plucking a counterfeit chip from the shards of broken bottles scattered across the floor.
LocationDesc: Even land ravaged by calamity a hundred times still clings to traces of human desire.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: A Concluded Game
Desc: "Look here! Someone tried slipping this counterfeit chip into the game and clearly got caught. That'd explain the brawl... laughable, isn't it? If you can't stomach losing, why sit at the table at all?"\n\nLilith's voice drips with mockery. You notice at once her clear disdain for cheaters, and when you point it out, she doesn't deny it.
RoleContents: ['"Only those who trust neither their skill nor their luck resort to cheating... As for me? I hold both firmly in my hands."']
LocationDesc: Even land ravaged by calamity a hundred times still clings to traces of human desire.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Ancient Tale
Desc: In fields crushed by calamity, a cluster of children sit by the haystacks, chewing gritty bread laced with sand as they sing an old nursery rhyme: "Once there was a long, long river. Its waters flowed down into hell, where devils forever chased after gold—miserly and insatiably greedy!"
LocationDesc: Everyone in the Scorched Borderland has heard the legend of the "Castle beneath the Inferno"—a golden fairy tale passed down as children come of age.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Ancient Tale
Desc: Lilith murmurs carelessly under her breath: "What a pity. If Mammon's Key hadn't been swindled away, I could've taken you to see hell with your own eyes."
RoleContents: ["And you, Bloodsworn? Aren't you curious what hell really looks like?"]
LocationDesc: Everyone in the Scorched Borderland has heard the legend of the "Castle beneath the Inferno"—a golden fairy tale passed down as children come of age.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Rain of Gold Coins
Desc: On the road to Whitehorse, you pass several abandoned villages, emptied by a mass exodus. After asking around, you learn the cause—a few days ago, gold coins rained from the sky in a sudden downpour. The villagers gained a windfall, but in doing so, drew relentless pursuit from the angels.
LocationDesc: A train disintegrated mid-air, transforming into a golden rain that scattered wealth evenly across the land.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Rain of Gold Coins
Desc: Now, those once-blessed villages have all been looted by angels. Most villagers have long since fled with their coins, abandoning the lands that once fed them.
RoleContents: ["Hah, Raphael's still as stingy as ever—sending angels to dig three feet into the earth, prying every last coin from between mortal fingers. It's almost comical."]
LocationDesc: A train disintegrated mid-air, transforming into a golden rain that scattered wealth evenly across the land.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Mammon's Throne Vacant
Desc: Everyone in the Scorched Borderland has seen Mammon's coins, but none know their true origin. Legend says the former Golden King, after igniting every furnace of hell, walked into the Infinite Illusion Realm—surrendering his soul to desires that could never be satisfied—and sealed shut the gate of the City of No Return. To this day, in that decaying royal city, Mammon's throne remains empty, awaiting the next one capable of passing the "Filtering" to ascend and once again wield the authority of the Golden Law.
LocationDesc: With Mammon's throne vacant for so long, it's bound to draw covetous eyes.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Mammon's Throne Vacant
Desc: When you ask Lilith what she thinks of the legend, she twirls her umbrella idly in the carriage and says dismissively she's never taken it seriously.
RoleContents: ["I never play the hero's treasure-hunt games. I only enjoy the fruits within reach. Risk my life chasing a ridiculous legend just to test its truth? I'd never do something so foolish."]
LocationDesc: With Mammon's throne vacant for so long, it's bound to draw covetous eyes.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Angel Harassment
Desc: In yet another sudden ambush, Lilith casually sends several pale-fleshed angels back to the Supreme Heaven. Though these angelic raids can't halt your advance, their unpredictable, incessant harassment is insufferably annoying.
LocationDesc: The closer you get to Whitehorse, the more Angel Executors you run into.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Angel Harassment
Desc: "Why are these angels wasting their time? First they scour villages for coins, then they waste effort ambushing us... it's like they've forgotten what their real mission is."\n\nLilith flicks blood from her umbrella as she mutters this offhand remark, but it sparks a thought in your mind. Maybe these ambushes aren't strategy at all. Maybe the angels are desperate, with nowhere else to turn.
RoleContents: ["Which can only mean one thing: even after stealing Mammon's Key, Raphael hasn't achieved her goal. She still wants something more, from us."]
LocationDesc: The closer you get to Whitehorse, the more Angel Executors you run into.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Fieldside Watcher
Desc: On the road, you come across a group of weary townsfolk from Whitehorse. They clutch rough, handmade weapons, their clothes spattered with blood. Each of them is gaunt as a stick, yet they wear proud smiles.
LocationDesc: "Pick up your weapons! Into the streets! Fight!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Fieldside Watcher
Desc: "The angels came again today to strip us of our coins, but our traps drove them off. The money hidden in the hills is all we have left for a better life, and we won't let them take it."\n\nTheir courage earns your respect. You share what little food remains on your wagon and wish them strength for the road ahead.
RoleContents: ["When the angels are gone, you're welcome in our town. We'll treat you to fresh cheese and fine wine!"]
LocationDesc: "Pick up your weapons! Into the streets! Fight!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Tavern Brawl Lottery
Desc: In a shabby roadside tavern, two filthy drunks claw at each other over a handful of gold coins. The crowd doesn't try to break it up. Instead, they cheer, egging them on to fight harder.
LocationDesc: "Hit him harder! Beat him bloody! In this rotten world, this is the only entertainment we've got!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Tavern Brawl Lottery
Desc: You break up the brawl and ask why the onlookers are so callous. They snap back impatiently, angry that you spoiled their show. Almost everyone here is a penniless gambler drawn by rumors of raining gold coins. Even if someone died right in front of them, the local constables wouldn't lift a finger.
RoleContents: ['No gold in the mud today, and I was itching for some fun. Then you butt in and ruin it. What rotten luck!']
LocationDesc: "Hit him harder! Beat him bloody! In this rotten world, this is the only entertainment we've got!"
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Nameless Ghost
Desc: In the Spiral Graveyard, you meet a ghost who won't stop chattering. He explains the nature of the illusion realm: here, anything imagined instantly comes into being—gold, treasures, fine food, whatever you desire.
LocationDesc: The ghost rambles on, pouring out thoughts bottled up for far too long.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Nameless Ghost
Desc: Because desires here are so easily fulfilled, residents eventually stop imagining trivial things and chase bigger ambitions. This nameless ghost built his sprawling architectural complex just to prove his talent as a designer.\n\nHis only regret is that no one here ever cares about his work—they're too consumed with themselves.
RoleContents: ['Ever heard of Baroque design? That style spread from the Sanctuary back in the last era...']
LocationDesc: The ghost rambles on, pouring out thoughts bottled up for far too long.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: White Paper Crane
Desc: Led onward by the nameless ghost, you see countless delicate white paper cranes scattered along the roadside, as if pointing the way forward.
LocationDesc: The illusion realm's path continues stretching onward, seemingly without end.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: White Paper Crane
Desc: Following the paper cranes, you pass through countless strange little scenes, each born from someone's imagination. Golden casinos glitter, quiet libraries beckon, bakeries send sweet scents into the air... In this illusion realm, it seems that any prayer truly can be answered.\n\nThanks to the paper cranes, you do not lose yourself in the sprawling labyrinth. Instead, you slip past each wonder safely and arrive before a towering hall.
RoleContents: ['Come on, the answer is just ahead!']
LocationDesc: The illusion realm's path continues stretching onward, seemingly without end.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Former Golden Lord
Desc: Curious about the cranes marking the path, you ask the ghost about them.\n\n"These? Mammon left them here. Follow them and you'll reach Mammon's hall. Whenever we face troubles, we always go to him, and he always shows us the way out."
LocationDesc: Peculiar paper cranes lie scattered along the roadside, like the breadcrumbs Hansel and Gretel left in fairy tales.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Former Golden Lord
Desc: From the ghost's explanation, you learn that the Golden King who vanished from the City of No Return a century ago seemed surprisingly kind and approachable.
RoleContents: ['I get it. He must have gotten lonely here and just wanted someone to talk to. Makes sense, really, in a place as dead and empty as this.']
LocationDesc: Peculiar paper cranes lie scattered along the roadside, like the breadcrumbs Hansel and Gretel left in fairy tales.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Treasure Junkyard
Desc: The ghost leads you through a junkyard piled with abandoned creations. In this illusion realm, anything made can only be destroyed by its creator. Over the years, all these forsaken trinkets and oddities have been dumped here instead.
LocationDesc: Ravens circle above this graveyard of treasure.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Treasure Junkyard
Desc: Morigan darts into the pile, drawn by a flash of light. It drags out a ragged doll, and you notice its eyes are cut from sapphire. Just as you marvel at what other riches might be buried here, the ghost snatches the toy away and presses a brand-new, identical doll into your hand.\n\n"Nothing here is irreplaceable. We do not even bother repairing old junk."
RoleContents: ["Caw! Don't steal my fun, you killjoy!"]
LocationDesc: Ravens circle above this graveyard of treasure.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Ghost Gathering
Desc: The illusion realm runs by its own laws, untouched by the real world. After walking for hours, night finally falls. Beneath a sky filled with brilliant stars, you see a group of ghosts gathered around a bonfire, dancing as they murmur: "I wish I could see what my children look like now... but if I leave, I can never return."
LocationDesc: You see the long-missed stars and moon, even if they are only illusions.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Ghost Gathering
Desc: Surprised, you ask the ghost beside you if the residents here can really leave by their own will. The ghost nods, but explains that no one has ever chosen to do so. Once you leave, you can never return, because the illusion realm can only be entered once.
RoleContents: ['This iron rule was laid down when the realm was first created. Not even Mammon himself can defy it.']
LocationDesc: You see the long-missed stars and moon, even if they are only illusions.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Lonely Architect
Desc: On the long road, you finally can't hold back and ask the ghost what purpose he has for imagining so many massive and useless buildings.\n\n"Meaninglessness is the greatest meaning of all," he replies simply. "Ancient kings also built useless statues in their plazas. At the time they meant nothing, but thousands of years later they became proof that those kings once lived."
LocationDesc: Rows upon rows of strange buildings stand along the roadside, built without regard for cost or reward.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Lonely Architect
Desc: You almost blurt out the question, "Do you want to be a king too?" but bite your tongue. Since the illusion realm can't create living beings, no matter how magnificent his works are, no future generation will ever be around to tell of them.
RoleContents: ["I could create countless ornate statues too, but I can't be bothered with designs that are just piles of elements. They are utterly vulgar."]
LocationDesc: Rows upon rows of strange buildings stand along the roadside, built without regard for cost or reward.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Divide and Conquer
Desc: Whitehorse is surrounded by angels, hungry for gold and for blood.\n\nYou rally the townsfolk to hold the front line, cutting down the angels one after another. Thanks to your calm and careful strategy, they manage to hold their ground with nothing but old shotguns in hand.
RoleContents: ["Don't be afraid! Help has come. Hold the formation!"]
LocationDesc: Whitehorse is surrounded by angels, hungry for gold and for blood.
LocationDescUnselect: Whitehorse is surrounded by angels, hungry for gold and for blood.

Name: Survey the Battlefield
Desc: Whitehorse is surrounded by angels, hungry for gold and for blood.\n\nYou send Lilith deep into enemy lines to scout their true numbers. The silver-haired demon darts between them, and with each swing of her umbrella, angels hidden in the hills explode into gore and tumble into the valleys below.
RoleContents: ["Hahaha, I'm only just getting started!"]
LocationDesc: Whitehorse is surrounded by angels, hungry for gold and for blood.
LocationDescUnselect: Whitehorse is surrounded by angels, hungry for gold and for blood.

Name: Fight Head-On
Desc: The angels realize that someone is helping the townsfolk defend themselves. The leading Executor orders a shift in formation, rallying their forces for a new attack on the town center.\n\nYou stay calm, directing the militia to hold the front line. Gunfire and explosions roar through the alleys as Whitehorse turns into a giant meat grinder. Hundreds of angels fall in the narrow streets.
RoleContents: ['Good work. Keep it up!']
LocationDesc: The angels realize that someone is helping the townsfolk defend themselves. The leading Executor orders a shift in formation, rallying their forces for a new attack on the town center.
LocationDescUnselect: The angels realize that someone is helping the townsfolk defend themselves. The leading Executor orders a shift in formation, rallying their forces for a new attack on the town center.

Name: Target the Commander
Desc:
The angels realize that someone is helping the townsfolk defend themselves. The leading Executor orders a shift in formation, rallying their forces for a new attack on the town center.

You call Lilith back from her skirmishing and gather all remaining strength to target the angel commander hiding at the rear.

Bang—

A blood bullet cuts through the battlefield, soaring across hundreds of meters and striking the commander atop a mountain for an instant kill.
RoleContents: ['Lucky Strike!']
LocationDesc: The angels realize that someone is helping the townsfolk defend themselves. The leading Executor orders a shift in formation, rallying their forces for a new attack on the town center.
LocationDescUnselect: The angels realize that someone is helping the townsfolk defend themselves. The leading Executor orders a shift in formation, rallying their forces for a new attack on the town center.

Name: Scatter the Forces
Desc:
The longer the battle drags on, the more exhausted the townsfolk become. You need a way to end this quickly.

You instruct Lilith to split their forces apart. She leaps from rooftop to rooftop with her Moon Umbrella, drawing the angels' attention. Just as they rush close, she detonates them into showers of blood and flesh.

At last, you and Lilith finish off the stragglers together. Though both your magical reserves are completely drained, the town is saved.
RoleContents: ["Oh no... I got blood on my clothes. Sleep well now, won't you?"]
LocationDesc: The longer the battle drags on, the more exhausted the townsfolk become. You need a way to end this quickly.
LocationDescUnselect: The longer the battle drags on, the more exhausted the townsfolk become. You need a way to end this quickly.

Name: Set Traps
Desc:
The longer the battle drags on, the more exhausted the townsfolk become. You need a way to end this quickly.

You direct Lilith to use her knightly power to plant hundreds of bombs around the outskirts of town. Then, you lure the angels into the minefield. Hearing that bold plan, she looks at you in surprise at first, then gives a smile of approval.

Following your plan, hundreds of bombs explode at once, wiping out the angels. At the cost of your last reserves of magic, the town is defended.
RoleContents: ['Perfect! I love going all-in and clearing the board in a single move!']
LocationDesc: The longer the battle drags on, the more exhausted the townsfolk become. You need a way to end this quickly.
LocationDescUnselect: The longer the battle drags on, the more exhausted the townsfolk become. You need a way to end this quickly.

Name: Take Cover
Desc: You quickly pull back behind the walls of the City of No Return, using its fortifications as cover while you engage the angels from above.\n\nAmid gunfire and chaos, hundreds of fresh bullet holes and angel blood cover the city walls evenly, turning the fortress into a bastion of flesh and steel.
RoleContents: ["If Mammon could see this, he'd be furious!"]
LocationDesc: Madam Raphael's angels guard the gate of the City of No Return. Once they spot you, they rush out from behind the boulders.
LocationDescUnselect: Madam Raphael's angels guard the gate of the City of No Return. Once they spot you, they rush out from behind the boulders.

Name: Destroy the Walls
Desc: Since your cover has already been blown, there's no point in hiding anymore. Lilith raises her hand and, with a single motion, blasts away an entire section of the city wall. The gate of the City of No Return becomes an open battlefield. The angels throw themselves at you, but without the walls for cover they're nothing more than white targets. Under your coordinated assault, their formation falls apart almost instantly.
RoleContents: ["What a shame. You were so close to seeing Mammon's legendary vault."]
LocationDesc: Madam Raphael's angels guard the gate of the City of No Return. Once they spot you, they rush out from behind the boulders.
LocationDescUnselect: Madam Raphael's angels guard the gate of the City of No Return. Once they spot you, they rush out from behind the boulders.

Name: Bypass the Angels
Desc: You signal to Lilith from afar to bypass the angels. Even at a distance, she immediately understands your intent. In the very next moment, she flashes to your side, grabs hold of you, and leaps high into the air, carrying you both hundreds of meters upward.
LocationDesc: Angels swarm toward you like locusts. Worn down by the relentless assault, you search for a way to escape.
LocationDescUnselect: Angels swarm toward you like locusts. Worn down by the relentless assault, you search for a way to escape.

Name: Bypass the Angels
Desc: From up here, you immediately spot the one commanding this battle—Madam Raphael, standing in the rear lines.
RoleContents: ["Ra-pha-el! It's time we finally settle our score!"]
LocationDesc: Angels swarm toward you like locusts. Worn down by the relentless assault, you search for a way to escape.
LocationDescUnselect: Angels swarm toward you like locusts. Worn down by the relentless assault, you search for a way to escape.

Name: Forced Breakthrough
Desc: You realize that the endless waves of angels are nothing but a distraction. Without hesitation, you signal Lilith to change tactics—the angels surrounding you must be eliminated first.
LocationDesc: Angels swarm toward you like locusts. Worn down by the relentless assault, you search for a way to escape.
LocationDescUnselect: Angels swarm toward you like locusts. Worn down by the relentless assault, you search for a way to escape.

Name: Forced Breakthrough
Desc: She instantly understands your plan. Raising her umbrella high, she fires a piercing beam of light from its tip. The blast carves open a long, straight path through the enemies. From up here, you immediately spot the one commanding this battle—Madam Raphael, standing in the rear lines.
RoleContents: ["Bingo. Looks like our timid little archangel can't even take a step without her minions protecting her."]
LocationDesc: Angels swarm toward you like locusts. Worn down by the relentless assault, you search for a way to escape.
LocationDescUnselect: Angels swarm toward you like locusts. Worn down by the relentless assault, you search for a way to escape.

Name: Clear the Surrounding Angels
Desc: You decide it's safer to clear out the angels guarding her before making your move.
LocationDesc: Madam Raphael's figure finally comes into view. Just one more push and she's within reach.
LocationDescUnselect: Madam Raphael's figure finally comes into view. Just one more push and she's within reach.

Name: Clear the Surrounding Angels
Desc: Blood floods into the barrel, unleashing a volley of crimson shots. The last few angels are torn apart into pulp on the battlefield. With no subordinates left to shield her, Raphael is forced to step onto the front lines and face you directly.
RoleContents: ['Now comes the main course. Stay focused!']
LocationDesc: Madam Raphael's figure finally comes into view. Just one more push and she's within reach.
LocationDescUnselect: Madam Raphael's figure finally comes into view. Just one more push and she's within reach.

Name: Attack Raphael Directly
Desc: You seize the opportunity and unleash a barrage of attacks on Raphael.
LocationDesc: Madam Raphael's figure finally comes into view. Just one more push and she's within reach.
LocationDescUnselect: Madam Raphael's figure finally comes into view. Just one more push and she's within reach.

Name: Attack Raphael Directly
Desc: A blood bullet strikes her body squarely, but the archangel's power instantly takes effect. The gaping wounds are sealed shut with golden runes. She rips the bullet from her flesh and, enraged, steps forward to confront you head-on.
RoleContents: ["Heh. Who would've thought our cowardly archangel could take a hit like that."]
LocationDesc: Madam Raphael's figure finally comes into view. Just one more push and she's within reach.
LocationDescUnselect: Madam Raphael's figure finally comes into view. Just one more push and she's within reach.

Name: Return of the Golden King
Desc: Within the City of No Return, no one can stand against the Golden King.
LocationDesc: Crowned as the new Mammon, Lilith pours every ounce of hatred she has carried straight onto Madam Raphael.
LocationDescUnselect: Crowned as the new Mammon, Lilith pours every ounce of hatred she has carried straight onto Madam Raphael.

Name: Return of the Golden King
Desc: Empowered by purgatory's molten fire and showers of golden fragments, Lilith tears open countless wounds in Raphael's body again and again. The more Raphael resists, the longer her torment drags on. She should have fallen long ago, but her pride as an archangel forces her to cling to her divine essence, refusing to fade.
RoleContents: ['Ridiculous! A mere archangel thinks she can stand against all of purgatory?!']
LocationDesc: Crowned as the new Mammon, Lilith pours every ounce of hatred she has carried straight onto Madam Raphael.
LocationDescUnselect: Crowned as the new Mammon, Lilith pours every ounce of hatred she has carried straight onto Madam Raphael.

Name: Final Gamble
Desc: The bottle city shakes violently, and the mountains of gold coins crumble into streams of glowing dust amid the clash.
LocationDesc: With the former Mammon's aid, Gray Raven escapes the illusion and confronts Lilith in one last showdown.
LocationDescUnselect: With the former Mammon's aid, Gray Raven escapes the illusion and confronts Lilith in one last showdown.

Name: Final Gamble
Desc: The battle continues. The wager that decides your future will drag on. Neither side will lay down their trump cards. Both of you have forced yourselves into a desperate gamble where only one can survive.
RoleContents: ['Excellent. Cast all your chips, and let them pave the steps for your advance!']
LocationDesc: With the former Mammon's aid, Gray Raven escapes the illusion and confronts Lilith in one last showdown.
LocationDescUnselect: With the former Mammon's aid, Gray Raven escapes the illusion and confronts Lilith in one last showdown.

Name: Desperate Gamble
Desc: You step into an abandoned bar. Poker cards still litter the black round table, and the fighting marks covering every surface silently tell of an ugly "free-for-all tournament" that once took place here.
LocationDesc: Overturned tables and chairs, shattered bottles scattered across the floor, bullet holes pockmarking the walls.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Desperate Gamble
Desc: Lilith crouches behind the bar, prying open the wooden cabinet beneath. She easily discovers a hidden chest of gold coins. Whether the owner stashed it here and triggered the chaos that followed, or someone shoved it in during the fight, no one can say for sure now.
RoleContents: ['How this treasure is handled is up to you.']
LocationDesc: Overturned tables and chairs, shattered bottles scattered across the floor, bullet holes pockmarking the walls.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Desperate Gamble
Desc: You choose to take the coins of uncertain origin. The crisp clinking as they fall into your pouch announces that the unfinished gamble in this ruined bar has finally come to an end.
LocationDesc: Overturned tables and chairs, shattered bottles scattered across the floor, bullet holes pockmarking the walls.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Desperate Gamble
Desc: You try to return the coins to nearby townsfolk. Yet everyone who arrives claims ownership, and another fight is about to break out. Unable to bear it any longer, Lilith steps in to deliver a harsh lesson, "educating" them not to quarrel over this fortune again.
LocationDesc: Overturned tables and chairs, shattered bottles scattered across the floor, bullet holes pockmarking the walls.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Desperate Gamble
Desc: Once it's settled, you and Lilith leave the bar. But has this desperate gamble truly ended?
LocationDesc: Overturned tables and chairs, shattered bottles scattered across the floor, bullet holes pockmarking the walls.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Roadside Mother
Desc: A woman by the roadside blocks your path. She explains that she urgently needs money. For just ten Mammon coins, you could buy her as a servant. She would serve for life, but with one condition—she must care for the child she is about to give birth to, and hopes her master will allow the child freedom to choose their path when they grow up.
LocationDesc: She curls up beneath a tree, clothes in tatters, face worn with sorrow.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Roadside Mother
Desc: You look toward Lilith, but she avoids your eyes, deliberately looking elsewhere as if to leave the choice to you.
RoleContents: ["I promise I'll raise my child myself. It won't interfere with my work. Please, just give us a chance!"]
LocationDesc: She curls up beneath a tree, clothes in tatters, face worn with sorrow.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Roadside Mother
Desc: You tell the woman about another town, Rusty Yoke, where an autonomous group may be able to help her.
LocationDesc: She curls up beneath a tree, clothes in tatters, face worn with sorrow.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Roadside Mother
Desc: The mother accepts your suggestion and prepares to leave. As she does, Lilith slips several coins into her palm.\n\n"Never speak so carelessly of selling your life again. Your child needs you." With that, Lilith turns away without looking back.
LocationDesc: She curls up beneath a tree, clothes in tatters, face worn with sorrow.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Roadside Mother
Desc: When you attempt to leave money for her, Lilith stops you. She beats you to it, placing a few gold coins in the mother's hand.
LocationDesc: She curls up beneath a tree, clothes in tatters, face worn with sorrow.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Roadside Mother
Desc: "This isn't charity—it's a loan. Don't think you can dodge repayment. No matter where you end up, I will come back for it." Lilith's words are stern, and then she walks away without another glance.
LocationDesc: She curls up beneath a tree, clothes in tatters, face worn with sorrow.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Snow Globe
Desc: On the road, you pass by an abandoned mansion. Pushing the door open, you find chaos and disarray strewn across the floor.\n\nLilith picks up a dust-covered crystal ball from the fireplace. After wiping it clean, she gently shakes it, and snow begins to swirl inside the globe. She stares at it with a serious, focused gaze, as if reminded of something from long ago.
RoleContents: ["Have you ever seen sunny snow? The flakes melt the moment they fall, so by the time they reach your palm, all that's left is water."]
LocationDesc: Snow drifts and swirls inside the glass dome, beautiful yet unreal.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Snow Globe
Desc: You can tell Lilith likes this little ornament. While she's distracted, you slip the snow globe into your pack.
LocationDesc: Snow drifts and swirls inside the glass dome, beautiful yet unreal.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Snow Globe
Desc: She tells you a brief story, but deliberately leaves out who the main character was.\n\nLegend has it that long, long ago, there was a town called the "Lucky City." Its entire economy depended on a single casino, Lucky 38, and the streets were always packed with visitors eager to test their luck.
LocationDesc: Snow drifts and swirls inside the glass dome, beautiful yet unreal.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Snow Globe
Desc: One day, a gambler won the whole casino. But instead of taking control, he ordered the previous owner to give away everything in the casino. By nightfall, greedy townsfolk stripped the casino bare. Not even a glass cup was left behind.
LocationDesc: Snow drifts and swirls inside the glass dome, beautiful yet unreal.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Snow Globe
Desc: You ask Lilith why the gambler didn't just take over the casino. She offers no explanation—only a sly smile. "Take a guess."
LocationDesc: Snow drifts and swirls inside the glass dome, beautiful yet unreal.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: A Meal
Desc: Passing by a remote mansion, you encounter an eccentric old man. He immediately recognizes Lilith as the gambler renowned across the frontier, and stops your carriage, demanding she share a meal with him and teach him some tricks for winning.
LocationDesc: The food smells cloyingly sweet, killing your appetite.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: A Meal
Desc: Considering how long you've traveled today, you agree to stay the night. The maids serve dishes that are all excessively rich and greasy, while the old man goes on and on about how glorious life was before the catastrophe. You can barely force down a bite.
RoleContents: ['Back in the day, before the angels marched down, I collected taxes for the entire town. Building a new mansion every year? Easy as breathing.']
LocationDesc: The food smells cloyingly sweet, killing your appetite.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: A Meal
Desc: You grit your teeth and endure the meal, while Lilith stands up and leaves midway through. The old man gains nothing useful, but the next morning he still has his maids politely escort you out.
LocationDesc: The food smells cloyingly sweet, killing your appetite.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: A Meal
Desc: You can't stand another word of his revolting, self-serving stories and call him out as nothing more than a parasite who feasts on the people's blood and sweat.
LocationDesc: The food smells cloyingly sweet, killing your appetite.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: A Meal
Desc: The old man flies into a rage and orders his maids to raise their guns at you. Lilith, long out of patience, immediately draws her umbrella. The mansion erupts into chaos, priceless furnishings reduced to rubble. Only then does the old man realize his mistake, crying out and begging her to stop, but Lilith no longer listens.
LocationDesc: The food smells cloyingly sweet, killing your appetite.
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Fantasy Paradise
Desc: A barefoot child blocks your carriage, asking if you know where the City of No Return is. She says she's going there to make a deal with the devils.
LocationDesc: "They say there's no pain there, no hunger. Any wish comes true the moment you ask for it."
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Fantasy Paradise
Desc: According to the child, in a place called the City of No Return, you can trade your soul to the devils for a ticket into "Fantasy Paradise." It's said to be a world without pain or hunger, where every wish comes true the moment you think of it. She believes her deceased parents and her brother are waiting there for her to join them.
RoleContents: ['Daddy, Mommy, and big brother are all waiting for me in the City of No Return. I have to go there right now...']
LocationDesc: "They say there's no pain there, no hunger. Any wish comes true the moment you ask for it."
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Fantasy Paradise
Desc: You try to explain to her that no such paradise exists, that it's nothing more than a story devils made up to harvest human souls. But she explodes in anger, shouting that Fantasy Paradise is real because her family promised her, before they died, that they would all reunite there..
LocationDesc: "They say there's no pain there, no hunger. Any wish comes true the moment you ask for it."
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Fantasy Paradise
Desc: After saying this, she turns away and leaves in a hurry, determined to find her so-called paradise.
LocationDesc: "They say there's no pain there, no hunger. Any wish comes true the moment you ask for it."
LocationDescUnselect: Here lie secrets you have not uncovered...

Name: Fantasy Paradise
Desc: You explain to the little girl that if paradise truly exists, it would be called Heaven, not something hidden in the devils' purgatory.\n\nThe girl shakes her head and argues back, saying that ever since the divine law collapsed, no one has been able to find Heaven anymore. At least that much, she says, she knows for certain.
LocationDesc: "They say there's no pain there, no hunger. Any wish comes true the moment you ask for it."
